etymology.description: Depicts a walled settlement with an enclosure and a road leading to it -> town or city
etymology.interpretation: 邑(邑) (yì, "town; city") originates from a pictogram representing a place enclosed by walls, characteristic of ancient cities with roads leading into them.

examples.chinese: 他游览了那座邑(他游覽了那座邑)，感受到了浓厚的历史气息(感受到了濃厚的歷史氣息)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yóulǎn le nà zuò yì, gǎnshòu dào le nónghòu de lìshǐ qìxī.
examples.english: He toured that town and experienced its rich historical atmosphere.

examples.chinese: 这个邑依山傍水(這個邑依山傍水)，生活节奏缓慢(生活節奏緩慢)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège yì yī shān bàng shuǐ, shēnghuó jiézòu huǎn màn.
examples.english: This town is nestled by the mountains and rivers, and its pace of life is slow.
